alert.note: Alert for Henry (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Tornado Warning issued January 12 at 3:43PM CST until January 12 at 4:15PM CST by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tallahassee has issued a * Tornado Warning for... Northern Henry County in southeastern Alabama... * Until 415 PM CST. * At 343 PM CST, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located over Texasville, or 10 miles east of Clio, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * This tornadic thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of northern Henry County, including the following locations... Screamer, Walter F. George Lock And Dam, Coates, Edwin, Thomas Mill Creek, Otho, Scottsboro Crossroads, Double Bridges and Lawrenceville. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
